document_data.name: Quomec Ziggurat
document_data.mainbody: The '''Quomec Ziggurat''', also sometimes called simply '''Quomec''', was a large ziggurat that sat in the jungles of northern [[Chult]].<ref name=FRCG-p102 />
document_data.Structure: The ziggurat stood twenty-eight levels tall. The exterior was inscribed with indecipherable glyphs, with the inscriptions near the base seeming to show a massive sarcophagus writhing with animated vines. At the top of the ziggurat sat a temple sealed behind enormous [[bronze]] doors.<ref name=FRCG-p102 />
document_data.History: As of the {{YearlinkName|1479}}, local tribes claimed that the ziggurat was the crypt of an emperor known as Lord [[Quomec]], although that name had not been recorded in any texts.<ref name=FRCG-p102 />
